page.title: 09Walks in the Coniston fells
page.content:
{WALKING & CLIMBING:}This is a walker's area: access to the fells is unrestricted, and there are many routes of varying hardness. A{mountain {walk}of 8 or 10km could take the walker to the top of such fells as {Coniston Old Man, Dow Crag, Swirl How or{Wetherlam.}The two main fellwalker's routes out of Coniston are; up the Walna Scar road to the SW, and up the line of Church Beck towards Coppermines Valley.
There are many pleasant{low-level {walks}through the woods and fields surrounding the lake.{Footpaths}are generally well-marked: signposting of public rights of way is carried out by the{National Park wardens.}In summer, {guided walks}are regularly available, starting from the Information Centre in the village.
